TextView.android:text: Using devices before bed can make it harder to sleep, primarily due to the blue light emitted by screens. Blue light tricks the brain into thinking it's daytime, which delays the release of melatonin, a hormone that helps the body wind down for sleep. Teens are especially sensitive to blue light, making it harder to fall asleep. Other factors, like late-night distractions and early school start times, can contribute to sleep deprivation. While dimming screens or wearing special glasses may help, there's no solid evidence they work. To improve sleep, it's best to avoid screens for at least an hour before bed and engage in other relaxing activities instead.
